<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Stiletto Pen](/Weapons.aspx?ID=137)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Agile" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=170" />
<trait label="Concealable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=327" />
<trait label="Finesse" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=179" />
<trait label="Thrown 10 ft." url="/Traits.aspx?ID=195" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [PFS Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=50) pg. 30</row>

**Access** Member of the Pathfinder Society.

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 8 gp

**Damage** 1d4 P

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Simple

**Group** [Dart](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=6)
</row>

</column>

---

This weapon is a fully functional, lavish ink pen with a clip that can be attached to a pocket or bandoleer and easily retrieved as a free action. Using an action to Interact with the pen allows its wielder to disengage a stiletto blade that slides free of the upper body or reattach the previously removed blade.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-6" />
name: Stiletto Pen
